title: Untitled

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of watercolor and gouache with graphite on off-white wove paper, laid down on tan wove card..

dimensions: Primary support: 22.7 × 18 cm (8 15/16 × 7 1/8 in.); Secondary support: 32.4 × 24.9 cm (12 13/16 × 9 13/16 in.)
medium_display: Watercolor and gouache with graphite on off-white wove paper, laid down on tan wove card.
inscriptions: Signed recto, upper right center, in graphite: "Klee"; lower left, in graphite: "1918 139"; verso, in graphite: "Buchholz" and "NY 11748"
credit_line: Bequest of the Clare Hoover Trust
publication_history:
Der Ararat (1920), p. 9 (ill.).

Leopold Zahn, Paul Klee, Leben, Werk, Geist (Potsdam, 1920), p. 64 (ill.).

Paul Klee: The Collection of F. C. Schang (South Norwalk, Conn., 1952), no. 4.

Paul Klee: The Collection of F. C. Schang (South Norwalk, Conn., 1953), no. 9, as Friendly Quartet.

Christine Hopfengart, Klee: Von Sonderfall zum Publikumsliebling (Mainz, 1989), p. 41.

Paul Klee Foundation, Paul Klee: Catalogue Raisonné, vol. 2 (Bern, 2000), p. 504, no. 1986 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Berlin, Galerie Der Sturm. "Paul Klee, Johannes Molzahn, Kurt Schwitters," January 1919, cat. 27. 

Munich, Galeriestrasse 26, "Neue Münchener Secession," June 1919.

Munich, Neue Kunst Hans Goltz, "Paul Klee," May 17-June 25, 1920, cat. 186 (ill.), as Freundliche vier. 

Berlin, Galerie Der Sturm, "Paul Klee, Hans Mattis Teutsch, Gesamtschau," July-August 1921, cat. 16.  

Tokyo, Buchhandlung Maruzen, "Expressionism," June 21-30, 1924, cat. 6/48.

Palm Beach, Fla., Society of the Four Arts, "Paintings by Paul Klee," March 9-April 1, 1951, cat. 9, as Freundliche vier.

New York, Saidenberg Gallery, "Paul Klee: An Exhibition of Paintings and Drawings Commemorating the 75th Anniversary of his Birth," March 8-April 26, 1954, cat. 5.
provenance_text: Galerie Neue Kunst Hans Goltz, Munich, about 1919 [Paul Klee Foundation 2000].  Buchholz Gallery, New York [Paul Klee Foundation 2000 and old label now in curatorial file].  Frederick Zimmermann, New York [Paul Klee Foundation 2000].  Frederick C. Schang, South Norwalk, Conn., and New York, by 1951 [Palm Beach, Fl. 1951].  Sold by Saidenberg Gallery, New York, to Clare Hoover, March 1954 [old label]; bequeathed by Clare Hoover Trust to the Art Institute, 1998.
copyright_notice: © 2018 Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York / VG Bild-Kunst, Bonn
